product_overview: A modern web-based platform digitizing the traditional Susu savings system, enabling users to create and join savings groups, track contributions and payouts, manage memberships, and view transaction histories with a secure and mobile-responsive interface.
core_goals: Enable users to securely register, log in, and manage their accounts within the platform.
Allow users to create, join, and manage Susu savings groups efficiently through an intuitive lifecycle system.
Facilitate seamless tracking of weekly contributions and payouts within groups to maintain financial transparency.
Provide users with a centralized dashboard showing their groups, activities, and quick feature access.
Ensure a responsive, user-friendly interface that works across devices using modern UI frameworks.
key_features: Complete user authentication with registration, login, logout, password hashing, and session management.
User dashboard displaying joined groups, recent activities, and quick navigation links.
Comprehensive group management including creation, joining, lifecycle state management, and member invitations via email tokens.
Payment processing module to track weekly contributions and disbursements within savings groups.
Detailed transaction history for transparency on all group financial activities.
User profile management allowing edits to personal and contact information.
Mobile-responsive, modern UI design built with TailwindCSS ensuring accessibility across devices.
Secure form validation with CSRF protection using Flask-WTF.
Robust backend built with Flask utilizing SQLAlchemy ORM for database operations.
user_flow_summary: Users register for an account, verify credentials, and log in securely.
Upon login, users land on a dashboard summarizing their groups and recent activities.
Users can create new Susu savings groups or join existing ones via invitations.
Group creators manage group members, track contributions, and oversee group lifecycle stages.
Members make weekly contributions recorded by the system and receive payout notifications.
Users review past transactions and group activities via history views.
Users can update their profile settings and manage authentication information as needed.
validation_criteria: All user authentication flows must be secure with password hashing and prevent unauthorized access.
Users must be able to successfully create, join, and leave groups, with group states handled correctly by the state machine.
Payment records must accurately reflect contributions and disbursements with no data loss.
Email invitations to group members must generate valid tokens and enable recipients to join groups securely.
The dashboard and other UI pages must be responsive and functional across major browsers and devices.
Data submitted through forms must be validated and CSRF-protected to prevent attacks.
User profile changes must persist correctly and update the database accordingly.
Application must handle error cases gracefully with appropriate user feedback and logging.
